summary: Echidnas, also called spiny anteaters, are unique mammals found in Australia and New Guinea. They are covered in quills and lay eggs, belonging to a group called monotremes. There are four different types of echidnas, and they are related to the platypus. These creatures eat ants and termites but are not related to other anteaters or hedgehogs. Baby echidnas are named puggles. Echidnas have been around for millions of years, evolving from an ancient aquatic mammal.
title: Echidna
